name: Lentil Kidney Bean Chili. 1 Pot Glutenfree Recipe
description: This Vegan Lentil Kidney Bean Chili is packed with flavor from the Taco spice blend and chipotle pepper. Warming, 1 Pot , full of protein. Gluten-free soy-free.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup dry Lentils (brown lentils or 1 cup cooked)
1  green chili (chopped (Serrano or Bird's eye or Jalapeno, to taste))
2 to 3 tsp taco spice blend (recipe below)
2 cups water (less or more to consistency preferred , use 1.5 cups if using cooked lentils)
Pickled jalapeno (cilantro, lemon juice, sour cream/yogurt, guacamole, tortilla strips for garnish.)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the lentils in hot water for half an hour. Drain and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the lentils in hot water for half an hour. Drain and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add oil, and heat on medium. Add the onion and cook until translucent. 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add oil, and heat on medium. Add the onion and cook until translucent. 4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the green chili pepper and garlic and cook for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the green chili pepper and garlic and cook for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tomatoes, chipotle pepper, taco spice and cook until tomatoes are saucy. 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the tomatoes, chipotle pepper, taco spice and cook until tomatoes are saucy. 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the bell pepper, celery, mix and cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the bell pepper, celery, mix and cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained lentils and kidney beans, salt and water and mix well. Cover and cook for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the drained lentils and kidney beans, salt and water and mix well. Cover and cook for 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir, taste and adjust salt and spice, and water if needed. Reduce heat to low-medium and cover and cook for another 20 minutes or until the lentils and kidney beans are very tender. (If using cooked lentils, simmer for 5 minutes.)
recipeInstructions.name: Stir, taste and adjust salt and spice, and water if needed. Reduce heat to low-medium and cover and cook for another 20 minutes or until the lentils and kidney beans are very tender. (If using cooked lentils, simmer for 5 minutes.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook uncovered to thicken the chili or add water if too thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook uncovered to thicken the chili or add water if too thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix in the corn and 1/2 tsp lemon juice. Sprinkle a bit more taco spice blend if you like. I did.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix in the corn and 1/2 tsp lemon juice. Sprinkle a bit more taco spice blend if you like. I did.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot, topped with some of vegan sour cream, cashew cream or yogurt, pickled jalapenos, chopped onion, a bunch of cilantro, non dairy cheddar, salsa, sliced avocado and anything and everything. To make this Indian, add garam masala instead of taco spice.
